meanings.definition: Relating to or exhibiting movement in response to temperature changes.
meanings.sent1: The thermotactic animals moved towards the warmth of the sun.
meanings.sent2: The thermotactic device automatically adjusts its settings based on the room temperature.
meanings.sent3: The thermotactic robot decided to take a break when it got too hot.
meanings.sent4: Her thermotactic behavior towards hot showers is like a magnet to warmth.
meanings.sent5: The thermotactic plants wilted under the scorching heat of the summer sun.

meanings.definition: A substance or organism that is attracted to or repelled by heat.
meanings.sent1: The thermotactic wasp sought out the warmest spot in the garden.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study thermotactics in insects to understand their behavior in different temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The thermotactic bacteria seemed to avoid the heat as if it were a hot potato.
meanings.sent4: The thermotactic moth fluttered towards the heat of the lamp like a moth to a flame.
meanings.sent5: The thermotactic fish swam closer to the underwater volcanic vents for warmth.
